result.purpose: Responsible for HMAC (Hash-based Message Authentication Code) functionality including signing, validation, and configuration.
result.architecture: The folder follows a modular architecture pattern, encapsulating HMAC-related functionalities into distinct files for configuration, signing, validation, and testing, promoting separation of concerns.

pkg/crypto/hmac/config.go.purpose: Defines a configuration structure for HMAC with normalization of whitelist addresses.
side_effects: Modifies the WhitelistAddresses field of the Config struct.

pkg/crypto/hmac/funcs.go.purpose: Provides HMAC signing functions using SHA256 and SHA512 algorithms.
risks: Potential for misuse of cryptographic functions if not used correctly.

pkg/crypto/hmac/funcs_test.go.purpose: Unit tests for the HMAC signing functionality.

pkg/crypto/hmac/hmac.go.purpose: Provides HMAC validation functionality including signature verification and clock skew validation.
side_effects: Prints error messages to console if parsing time fails.
risks: Potential for time manipulation attacks if clock skew is not properly validated.

pkg/crypto/hmac/hmac_test.go.purpose: Unit tests for HMAC validation functions, checking clock skew and signature validation.
risks: Potential exposure of sensitive data due to redacted values.

pkg/crypto/hmac/init.go.purpose: This file initializes a singleton instance of the HMAC structure with a configuration.
side_effects: Initializes a global instance of HMAC
risks: Potential race conditions if InitInstance is called concurrently without proper synchronization
